page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY 3
page.content: was greatly eased by the opening of the Leeds and Liverpool Canal in 1820 and the railway (built by the East Lancashire Railway Company) in l858. In the 20th Century Oswaltwistle saw the decline of the Cotton Industry and the development of much smaller and specialised industries. Many of the old mills are now split into Industrial Units, having such industries as furniture making, carpets, footwear and light engineering. The chemical works initially built to supply demand from the Cotton Industry still thrive producing chemicals for a much larger market. St. Paul's C.E. Primary School
